pull.title: build: Improve build instructions
pull.body:
- Add separate boost package instructions for Ubuntu 15.10
- Clarify BerkeleyDB/wallet situation for unix
- Add basic build instructions for Windows (closes #1401)

[skip ci]

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

events.body: The statement about individual package names for Ubuntu is a little unclear.  First, you say that for 15.10+ you can do this with individual -dev packages, but then you go on to say that for 12.04+ you have to use the -all-dev.  Did I misread?
Good point, will change that to say pre-15.10.
BTW it is probably the same for newer versions of Debian, I just don't know so I kept that the same. Installing `libboost-all-dev` is a safe fallback.

Text-Review ACK.
It would be nice to shuffle Qt4/5 order in the `doc/build-unix.md` around L106. We should first mention Qt5 and maybe "tag\* Qt4 as supported but not optimized for (or something similar).

>  It would be nice to shuffle Qt4/5 order in the doc/build-unix.md around L106. We should first mention Qt5 and maybe "tag\* Qt4 as supported but not optimized for (or something similar).

Yes, good idea.

events.message:
build: Improve build instructions

- Add package instructions for Ubuntu 15.10
- Clarify BerkeleyDB/wallet situation for unix
- Add basic build instructions for Windows (closes #1401)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,38 @@
+WINDOWS BUILD NOTES
+====================
+
+Some notes on how to build Bitcoin Core for Windows.
+
+Building on Windows itself is possible, but no one documented the steps to do this.
+
+All developers use cross-compilation to build executables for Windows from Ubuntu. This is also used for the released binaries.
+
+Cross-compilation
+-------------------
+
+These steps can be performed on, for example, an Ubuntu VM. The depends system
+will also work on other Linux distributions, however the commands for
+installing the toolchain will be different.
+
+First install the toolchains:
+
+    sudo apt-get install g++-mingw-w64-i686 mingw-w64-i686-dev g++-mingw-w64-x86-64 mingw-w64-x86-64-dev
+
+To build executables for Windows 32-bit:
+
+    cd depends
+    make HOST=i686-w64-mingw32 -j4
+    cd ..
+    ./configure --prefix=`pwd`/depends/i686-w64-mingw32
+    make
+
+To build executables for Windows 64-bit:
+
+    cd depends
+    make HOST=x86_64-w64-mingw32 -j4
+    cd ..
+    ./configure --prefix=`pwd`/depends/x86_64-w64-mingw32
+    make
+
+For further documentation on the depends system see [../depends/README.md](README.md) in the depends directory.
comments.body:
Nit: Syntax is wrong. Try `[Read](../link)`

Unrelated note: You may want to remove the `(closes #1401)` from the commit message because GitHub parses this every time this appears in a commit with a different hash (e.g. force push, cherry-pick)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -61,34 +61,40 @@ Dependency Build Instructions: Ubuntu & Debian
 ----------------------------------------------
 Build requirements:
 
-	sudo apt-get install build-essential libtool autotools-dev autoconf pkg-config libssl-dev libevent-dev
+        sudo apt-get install build-essential libtool autotools-dev autoconf pkg-config libssl-dev libevent-dev
comments.body:
Nit: these whitespaces are not consistent throughout the document.

Some code parts are wrapped with ```, while others are not, and the number of spaces seems to be different (e.g. "To build": 0, Build requirements" has more than "To build with Qt 4...").

 ----------------------------------------------
 Build requirements:
 
-	sudo apt-get install build-essential libtool autotools-dev autoconf pkg-config libssl-dev libevent-dev
+        sudo apt-get install build-essential libtool autotools-dev autoconf pkg-config libssl-dev libevent-dev
comments.body:
Well, if only the rendered output matters, then I suggest to use plain ``` around code parts, without spaces.

But it actually doesn't look correct: "To build" isn't indented, while "Build requirements" is [...].

Here's an example from another part:

![intend](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5836089/10935857/23fe3438-82e9-11e5-8941-c258494e13d2.png)
